metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2546 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The report API in the crypto user configuration API in the Linux kernel through 3.8.2 uses an incorrect C library function for copying strings, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory by leveraging the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability. Mathias Krause discovered a memory leak in the Linux kernel's crypto report API. A local user with CAP_NET_ADMIN could exploit this leak to examine some of the kernel's stack memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
